summary: The U.S. Agency for International Development has standard processes to manage risks to its delivery of assistance in countries worldwide. But in countries affected by violent conflict, dangerous conditions can limit USAID's ability to directly oversee its assistance—increasing the risk of fraud or corruption. We reviewed how USAID manages risks, particularly in 3 countries currently experiencing violent conflict: Nigeria, Somalia, and Ukraine. We found that...
title: Foreign Assistance: USAID Should Strengthen Risk Management in Conflict Zones
